location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from Benjamin Jervis, East India Company Resident at Bushere [Bushire], and his assistants, William Bowyear and John Sebastian Natter, to Peter Elwin Wrench, East India Company Agent at Bussora [Basra]

mods.abstract: The letter discusses four missing bales of broadcloth, blaming the naucuda (Arab captain) of one of the vessels that transported the Company's stocks from Gombroon [Bandar Abbas] to Bushire when withdrawing in 1763. It is suggested that compensation from the Sheikh of Lingo [Lingeh], where the captain was from, should be sought. It is also reported that Sakee Khaun [Zaki Khan] has returned to Schirass [Shiraz] with his men.
